Lalu ada dawet gandul ketan khas Pleret yang dicampur dengan bubur sumsun dan grandul atau bola-bola yang terbuat dari tepung ketan dengan rasa kenyal dan gurih.

Ada juga es dawet jabung dari Ponorogo, es dawet Jepara, es dawet Semarangan dan es dawet Siwalan dari Jawa Timur. Serta es dawet telasih dari Solo dan es batil Lamongan yang terbuat dari roti tepung berasm parutan kelapa dan ragi.
foods.description_en:
Es dawet wetoh is a traditional Javanese drink made from rice flour, coconut milk, sugar, and grated ice. This drink has a sweet and savory taste so it is suitable for all ages.

Dawet is one of the refreshing drinks that is one of Indonesia's culinary specialties. In Yogyakarta and Central Java, this sweet and savory drink consists of coconut milk, kinca and also rice flour dough. In West Java, this type of drink is also known as cendol. From the story that developed, the term cendol probably comes from the word 'jendol' which is found in Sundanese, Javanese and Indonesian. This refers to the sensation of the jendalan felt when the cendol grains pass through the mouth. Quoted from the book Gastronomi Indonesia Volume 2, the type of cendol is known by its color such as green, white or black cendol.

Meanwhile, one of the famous types of dawet in Java is dawet ayu from Banjarnegara. Its characteristic is that there are symbols of Semar and Gareng on the seller's cart. Meanwhile, in Butuh District, Purworejo, black dawet ice is famous. The word black comes from Javanese which means black. The black color comes from straw burning powder mixed with water to produce black water for coloring. Then there is the typical Pleret sticky rice dawet gandul mixed with sumsun porridge and grandul or balls made from sticky rice flour with a chewy and savory taste.

There is also jabung dawet ice from Ponorogo, Jepara dawet ice, Semarangan dawet ice and Siwalan dawet ice from East Java. As well as telasih dawet ice from Solo and Lamongan batil ice made from rice flour bread, grated coconut and yeast.

foods.name: Es Manten
foods.description_id: Es Manten, sajian minuman segar yang bisa menghilangkan dahaga. Perpaduan warna-warni agar-agar merah, hijau, dan putih yang lembut dan kenyal, berpadu dengan sensasi kenyalnya nata de coco, serta biji selasih yang memberikan tekstur unik di setiap sendokan. Semua ini direndam dalam sirup manis yang diracik dari gula pasir, air, dan harumnya kayu manis. Aroma pandan yang khas memberikan rasa segar yang membekas di lidah
foods.description_en: Es Manten, a refreshing drink that can quench your thirst. A combination of soft and chewy red, green, and white agar-agar, combined with the chewy sensation of nata de coco, and basil seeds that provide a unique texture in every spoonful. All of this is soaked in a sweet syrup made from granulated sugar, water, and the aroma of cinnamon. The distinctive aroma of pandan provides a fresh taste that lingers on the tongue.

foods.name: ES TAYO
foods.description_id: Minuman Khas CRM yakni Es Tayo adalah sajian segar dengan perpaduan melon serut, setup nanas, cincau hitam, dan potongan agar-agar yang kenyal. Ditambah dengan siraman sirup cocopandan dan melon yang berpadu dengan susu kental manis, menciptakan kesegaran rasa yang menyegarkan
foods.description_en: CRM's signature drink, Es Tayo, is a refreshing drink with a combination of shaved melon, pineapple syrup, black grass jelly, and chewy agar-agar pieces. Added with a sprinkling of cocopandan syrup and melon combined with sweetened condensed milk, creating a refreshing taste.

foods.name: Wedang Uwuh
foods.description_id:
Wedang Uwuh adalah minuman tradisional khas Yogyakarta yang terbuat dari berbagai rempah-rempah alami seperti jahe, kayu secang, daun pala, daun kayu manis, gagang cengkeh, dan gula batu. Minuman ini dikenal memiliki rasa hangat dan kaya rempah, sangat cocok dinikmati di cuaca dingin. Nama 'uwuh' dalam bahasa Jawa berarti 'sampah'.
Minuman ini dinamakan demikian karena bahan-bahannya berupa daun-daunan dan rempah kering yang jika dilihat sekilas tampak seperti tumpukan sampah, meskipun sebenarnya memiliki banyak manfaat bagi kesehatan. Menurut situs warisanbudaya.kemdikbud.go.id, asal-usul Wedang Uwuh berkaitan dengan kisah Sultan Agung, Raja Mataram dari Yogyakarta. Diceritakan bahwa suatu hari Sultan Agung bersama para pengawalnya mencari lokasi untuk dijadikan makam keluarga kerajaan. Setelah berkeliling, mereka akhirnya memilih Bukit Merak di daerah Imogiri, Bantul.
Sebelum keputusan tersebut disahkan, Sultan Agung memutuskan untuk melakukan semedi di lokasi tersebut. Pada malam hari, beliau meminta seorang pengawal untuk membuatkan minuman hangat. Pengawal pun menyiapkan wedang secang dan meletakkannya di bawah pepohonan dekat tempat sang raja bersemedi. Karena angin malam bertiup kencang, daun-daun dan ranting-ranting pohon berjatuhan ke dalam wadah wedang tanpa sepengetahuan siapa pun. Dalam gelap malam, Sultan Agung meminum wedang tersebut dan merasa bahwa minuman itu sangat nikmat serta mampu menghangatkan tubuhnya. Keesokan harinya, Sultan Agung meminta dibuatkan minuman yang sama.
Ketika pengawal melihat kembali wadah minuman sang raja, ia menyadari bahwa isi minuman tersebut berbeda dari resep awal. Ia pun mencoba meracik ulang campuran baru tersebut, dan ternyata rasanya sesuai dengan yang dimaksud sang raja. Sejak saat itu, minuman tersebut menjadi favorit Sultan Agung dan masyarakat sekitar. Minuman itu pun diberi nama Wedang Uwuh, dan hingga kini menjadi salah satu warisan kuliner khas Yogyakarta yang masih sangat populer.
foods.description_en:
Wedang Uwuh is a traditional drink from Yogyakarta made from various natural spices such as ginger, sappanwood, nutmeg leaves, cinnamon leaves, clove stems, and rock sugar. This drink is known to have a warm and rich spice taste, perfect for enjoying in cold weather. The name 'uwuh' in Javanese means 'garbage'.
This drink is so named because the ingredients are leaves and dried spices which at first glance look like piles of garbage, even though they actually have many health benefits. According to the site Warisanbudaya.kemdikbud.go.id, the origin of Wedang Uwuh is related to the story of Sultan Agung, King of Mataram from Yogyakarta. It is said that one day Sultan Agung and his guards were looking for a location to be used as a tomb for the royal family. After going around, they finally chose Merak Hill in the Imogiri area, Bantul.
Before the decision was ratified, Sultan Agung decided to meditate at that location. At night, he asked a guard to make a warm drink. The guard then prepared secang wedang and placed it under the trees near where the king was meditating. Because the night wind blew hard, leaves and tree branches fell into the container of wedang without anyone's knowledge. In the dark of night, Sultan Agung drank the wedang and felt that the drink was very delicious and was able to warm his body. The next day, Sultan Agung asked for the same drink to be made. When the guard looked back at the king's drink container, he realized that the contents of the drink were different from the original recipe. He tried to remix the new mixture, and it turned out that the taste was according to what the king meant. Since then, the drink has become a favorite of Sultan Agung and the surrounding community. The drink was named Wedang Uwuh, and until now it has become one of Yogyakarta's culinary heritages that is still very popular.
